Who We Are
The Barking Lot is a volunteer-run pet rescue. We take in animals of all kinds and strive to find each and every one of them a home!
If you\'re here to foster…
Then thank you for considering it! Fostering is very important, and saves countless pets daily. By doing so you\'re helping all kinds of animals find safe and happy homes!
Read more about fostering
https://ontariospca.ca/adopt/become-a-foster-family/
If you\'re here to adopt…
Then thank you for adopting, not shopping! Stop puppy mills, inhumane breeders, and exotic pet dealers by adopting the animals that are already here and need you.
See who\'s ready for adoption
https://www.adoptapet.com/
Find us online!
We hate to ask but…
We\'re a volunteer run organization that is funded exclusively by donations. If you\'re able, consider donating to support us!
Donate
https://ontariospca.ca/how-to-help/other-ways-to-donate/

Animal Information
How much attention do they need?
How active are they?
Are they difficult to care for?
Do they need a cage/tank/terrarium?
Do they need outdoor space?
What kind of friend am I getting?
How much upkeep do they need?
Kittens
Kittens shouldn\'t be left unsupervised for long periods of time. They can get into all kinds of trouble and they can get into all kinds of small places.
They don\'t need a lot of strenuous activity, like walking or playing, but they can be a lot to keep up with and a close eye should be kept on them.

Taking care of a kitten is more work than that of an adult cat, but if they\'re healthy and well tempered taking care of them shouldn\'t be very demanding. There\'s always lots of resources to help new owners too.

Cats generally don\'t need dedicated cages, but kittens need to have somewhere they can be kept while you\'re away or sleeping. Keeping them in one room usually works just fine, like a bathroom where they can\'t get in to a lot of trouble, or a single bedroom with the door closed.
It\'s dangerous for cats to be let outdoors, and doubly so for kittens. Unless you\'re keeping them on a leash, they should be indoors.
Kittens are more active and playful when they\'re younger, and tend to mellow out with age.
Kittens very rarely need to be bathed but after 3 months old, brushing should be a regular occurrence. As they get older they\'ll need the occasional teeth cleaning and nail trimming.
Adult Cats
Unless your cat is particularly aloof, you should be spending some time with them, but you probably don\'t need to go out of your way to set aside the time.
Fully grown cats tend to be very low maintenance. They might be willing to play for a little, but they can usually keep themselves entertained.
An adult cat is usually a very low maintenance pet and there\'s a lot of resources for beginners.
Adult cats don\'t need a dedicated enclosure. They might get in to some trouble, but that just comes with having a pet.
It\'s dangerous for cats to be let outdoors. Unless you\'re keeping them on a leash, they should be indoors.
Some cats are very aloof and some are very cuddly. It\'s important to ask about their temperament or spend some time getting to know them before you make a decision to bring them home.
It\'s very rare to need to bathe a cat. Usually all they need is regular brushing, nail trimming, and the occasional tooth cleaning.
Elderly Cats
An elderly cat is probably going to be very low energy. If you pay attention to them when they ask, they\'ll probably be happy.
An elderly cat isn\'t going to need hardly any regular activity. Maybe get a laser pointer and see if they feel like chasing it.

Cats are overall a fairly easy pet for beginners, but as they age more attention needs to be paid to their health. Joints, teeth, diet and other factors can all impact how much work they are going to be as they age.
Elderly cats don\'t need dedicated enclosures. They\'re generally more low-energy and won\'t get into as much trouble.
It\'s dangerous for cats to be let outdoors. Unless you\'re keeping them on a leash, they should be indoors.
Some cats are very aloof and some are very cuddly. It\'s important to ask about their temperament or spend some time getting to know them before you make a decision to bring them home.
It\'s very rare to need to bathe a cat. Usually all they need is regular brushing, nail trimming, and the occasional tooth cleaning.
Puppies
Dogs need regular grooming and this is probably going to be even more true for a rowdy puppy. Bathing, brushing, teeth cleaning, etc.
Adult Dogs
Dogs need regular bathing and let\'s be real, you\'re probably going to get water everywhere while you do it. Don\'t forget trying to clip their nails and brush their teeth.
Elderly Dogs
Elderly dogs might not make as much of a mess in the bathtub, but they still need regular grooming. Bathing, nail clipping, tooth brushing, the whole works.
Other Pets
Most other pets such as rodents, reptiles, and fish require little dedicated attention. If you are caring for them right, they can usually be left alone for most of the day.

If you set up their enclosure right, you\'re not going to need to do a lot to make sure they\'re active and entertained. Hamster wheels exist for a reason, and it\'s so you don\'t have to try and walk them.

Reptiles, fish, some rodents, and other animals usually have pretty specific requirements for their care. Sometimes it\'s not easy to determine what\'s good advice and what\'s not, so it wouldn\'t hurt to have more pet experience under your belt.

Most of these pets will require some kind of enclosure. If you\'re looking to take care of them right, you should make sure it\'s the appropriate size. It\'s their home, would it be fair if it was just a small, cramped box? This means sometimes the enclosures can get pretty big depending on the animal and how many you\'re planning to have.
Have you ever seen someone take a lizard for a walk? You can if you want but you almost definitely won\'t need to.

Generally these pets will keep to themselves. Some might require a companion to keep them company, such as guinea pigs, but they generally won\'t be all that interested in you. That doesn\'t mean you can\'t still hangout with them though.
Most of these pets won\'t require dedicated grooming. Bathing and brushing will be pretty much a non-issue. Make sure to keep their enclosure clean though.
You said you\'re a pro so…

Fosters and adoption agencies are always looking for experienced people to help with more challenging pets. It can be hard to find people prepared to take in ill pets that need specific care, or folks with the experience to help rehabilitate abused or feral animals. Talk to one of our volunteers to see who we have that needs help.
OOPS! Looks like theres no match…
Try taking the quiz again, or chat with our volunteers to see what they have to say!
Welcome to the PetMatcher Quiz!

\t\tNot sure what kind of furry (or not) friend you\'re looking for? Let us help you decide! Take this quiz for a quick look at who might suit your lifestyle.\n\n \t\tKeep in mind this is just a recommendation, and all pets have their own personalities and quirks. Contact us to talk to a volunteer and see who they think would suit you!
Begin the quiz
How many hours of free time do you usually have?
Are you okay with regular grooming?
How active are you? (Or how active do you want to be?)
Do you have access to an outdoor space?\n(Such as a yard, or a near by park)
Does your home have room for an enclosure?\n(Such as a cage, tank, or terrarium)
How experienced are you as a pet owner?
What kind of companionship do you want?
Enough time to take this quiz but not much else
I have a healthy work/life balance
All the time in the world
I\'d really rather not…
I\'ll do it when it needs to be done but I\'ll hate every minute of it
Listen, no one likes to do it but I\'d do it as much as needed if not more to care of my little buddy
Not a lot okay? I don\'t need your judgement
A fair bit but I don\'t always want to be or have time
I\'m an active person or I want to be
Nope
Yes but I can\'t say I\'ll always be able to go
Yes and I\'m willing to be there regularly
No not really
Yes if it\'s not too big
Yes I can set up a pet palace
Not a lot (I\'m new to taking care of animals or I don\'t want to do a lot of research)
A fair amount (I\'ve had a pet or two before or I\'m willing to learn more)
They call me the Jackson Galaxy of all pets (I\'m an expert or I\'d be willing to put in a lot of work)
More like, a casual roommate?
A cool friend that I can hangout with sometimes but does their own thing too
A best friend ❤️
